from marilib import numpy
from copy import deepcopy

      

[docs]def s_min(min): return min*60.   # Translate minutes into seconds



[docs]def min_s(s): return s/60.   # Translate seconds into minutes



[docs]def s_h(h): return h*3600.   # Translate hours into seconds



[docs]def h_s(s): return s/3600.   # Translate seconds into hours



[docs]def m_ft(ft): return ft*0.3048   # Translate feet into metres



[docs]def ft_m(m): return m/0.3048   # Translate metres into feet



[docs]def m_NM(NM): return NM*1852.   # Translate nautical miles into metres



[docs]def NM_m(m): return m/1852.   # Translate metres into nautical miles



[docs]def mps_kmph(kmph): return kmph*1000./3600.   # Translate knots into meters per second



[docs]def kmph_mps(mps): return mps*3600./1000.   # Translate knots into meters per second



[docs]def mps_kt(kt): return kt*1852/3600   # Translate knots into meters per second



[docs]def kt_mps(mps): return mps*3600./1852.   # Translate meters per second into knots



[docs]def mps_ftpmin(ftpmin): return ftpmin*0.3048/60.   # Translate feet per minutes into meters per second



[docs]def ftpmin_mps(mps): return mps/0.3048*60.   # Translate meters per second into feet per minutes



[docs]def liter_usgal(usgal): return usgal*3.7853982   # Translate US gallons into liters



[docs]def usgal_liter(liter): return liter/3.7853982   # Translate liters into US gallons



[docs]def rad_deg(deg): return deg*numpy.pi/180.   # Translate degrees into radians



[docs]def deg_rad(rad): return rad*180./numpy.pi   # Translate radians into degrees



[docs]def J_kWh(kWh): return kWh*3.6e6   # Translate kWh into J



[docs]def J_MWh(MWh): return MWh*3.6e9   # Translate MWh into J



[docs]def kWh_J(J): return J/3.6e6   # Translate J into kWh



[docs]def MWh_J(J): return J/3.6e9   # Translate J into MWh



[docs]def daN_N(N): return N/10.   # Translate N into daN



[docs]def N_daN(N): return daN*10.   # Translate daN into N



[docs]def pc_no_dim(no_dim): return no_dim*100.   # Translate no dimension value into percentile



[docs]def no_dim_pc(no_dim): return no_dim/100.   # Translate percentile into no dimension value




[docs]def smart_round(X, S):
    Fac = (10 * numpy.ones(S))**numpy.min(4, max(0, 4 - round(numpy.log10(S))))
    return round(X * Fac)  # Fac



#=========================================================================
#
#	Generic unit converter
#
#=========================================================================
UNIT = {}

# dim = "Distance"
UNIT["m"] = 1.
UNIT["cm"] = 0.01
UNIT["mm"] = 0.001
UNIT["inch"] = 0.0254
UNIT["in"] = 0.0254
UNIT["km"] = 1000.
UNIT["ft"] = 0.3048
UNIT["NM"] = 1852.

UNIT["km/year"] = 1.

# Conversion functions
#-------------------------------------------------------------------------

[docs]def convert_from(ulab, val):
    # Convert val expressed in ulab to corresponding standard unit
    if isinstance(val, (type(None), str)):
        return val
    if isinstance(val, list):
        return [convert_from(ulab, v) for v in val]
    if isinstance(val, tuple):
        return (convert_from(ulab, v) for v in val)
    if isinstance(val, numpy.ndarray):
        return numpy.array([convert_from(ulab, v) for v in val])
    if isinstance(val, dict):
        dic_val = deepcopy(val)
        for k, v in dic_val.items():
            dic_val[k] = convert_from(ulab, v)
        return dic_val
    return val * UNIT[ulab]




[docs]def convert_to(ulab, val):
    # Convert val expressed in standard unit to ulab
    if isinstance(val, (type(None), str)):
        return val
    if isinstance(val, list):
        return [convert_to(ulab, v) for v in val]
    if isinstance(val, tuple):
        return tuple([convert_to(ulab, v) for v in val])
    if isinstance(val, numpy.ndarray):
        return numpy.array([convert_to(ulab, v) for v in val])
    if isinstance(val, dict):
        dic_val = deepcopy(val)
        for k, v in dic_val.items():
            dic_val[k] = convert_to(ulab, v)
        return dic_val
    if ulab in ["integer", "int", "entier", "numeric"]:
        val = int(val)
    return val / UNIT[ulab]
